title: Why Jan. 6 Aftershocks Defy Expectations
sub_head: A year after the riot, Donald Trump remains dominant among Republicans and his election-fraud myth lives on
body:
When a mob of Trump supporters ransacked the Capitol on Jan. 6 in an attempt to overturn the results of a national election, it was logical to assume that, in the aftermath of such a national embarrassment, two developments would ensue. First, former President Donald Trumpâ€™s role as a dominant figure in the Republican party would be reduced, and, second, the durability of his election-fraud myth would be diminished.
Almost exactly a year later, neither has happened.
